item.title: Fist blog post
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: Finally, after a few days of troubleshooting, I have succeeded in launching my first website with Hugo! My current setup is GitHub Pages + Hugo + Blogdown as described in this excellent tutorial by Amber Thomas. This allows me to create rich web content by utilizing Rmarkdown files with the blogdown package in Rstudio. I chose to use Hugo because it produces static websites. The idea of a static website is that websites are viewed far more often than they are edited, hence the building is only done when the content is created.
